study_identification.author_journal_year: Elad et al., Human Brain Mapping, 2021
study_identification.title: Improving the predictive potential of diffusion MRI in schizophrenia using normative models -Towards subject-level classification

study_characteristics.study_objective: To evaluate whether normative modeling can improve subject-level predictions for schizophrenia classification by generating age- and sex-adjusted z-scores from standard (FA) and advanced (free-water) dMRI measures in 18 white matter ROIs, and to test whether combining deviations across multiple imaging measures and tracts improves binary classifier performance compared to raw dMRI values.

model_origin.reason: The paper describes constructing a new normative model from the healthy controls in the current dataset using Nadaraya-Watson estimators.
model_origin.supporting_text: The normative model represents the distribution of the normative range within each ROI in the healthy controls using the sample mean and standard deviation. To control for confounding factors resulting from age and sex differences, we represented the normative range in each ROI by an age specific weighted mean, c mh , and standard deviation, b σ 2 h , for each sex separately. To do so, we used the NadarayaWatson (NW) estimator (Nadaraya, 1964; Watson, 1964) with a Gaussian kernel

model_origin_detail.answer: Within-study HC reference; sex-stratified Nadaraya–Watson kernel estimators for age-specific mean and variance; bandwidth via cross-validation.
model_origin_detail.reason: Describes sex-specific, age-weighted NW estimation and bandwidth selection.
model_origin_detail.supporting_text: ...age specific weighted mean ... and standard deviation ... for each sex separately. ... Nadaraya-Watson (NW) estimator ... bandwidth parameter ... minimized the cross-validation function...

modeling_method.answer: Nonparametric kernel regression (Nadaraya–Watson) for normative means/SDs; z-score deviations; Ridge logistic regression for classification
modeling_method.reason: NW estimator used to derive age/sex adjusted z-scores; ridge logistic used for classification.
modeling_method.supporting_text: ...Nadaraya-Watson (NW) estimator ... z-score ... We chose logistic regression with ridge regularization ...

software_tool.answer: Custom implementation (Nadaraya-Watson estimator with cross-validation for bandwidth selection)
software_tool.reason: The paper describes implementing the NW estimator with custom cross-validation for bandwidth selection, but does not specify a particular software package.
software_tool.supporting_text: To do so, we used the NadarayaWatson (NW) estimator (Nadaraya, 1964; Watson, 1964) with a Gaussian kernel [...] To set h for every ROI, and every dMRI modality (FA, FAt, or FW), we minimized the cross-validation function
